result.execSummary:
The defendant Maurice Wayne Williams Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Receiving or Concealing Stolen Property (<=$2500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.34(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Attorney Mary Garvin Guimont in court, defendant Maurice Wayne Williams not in court, in custody.  Jessica Bellows appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for a restitution hearing. Court ordered restitution in the amount of $0.00 (zero).

Statements made as to Sentencing by both counsel and Defendant.

Defendant sentenced to serve 9 MONTHS in the House of Correction consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 0 days time served.  

Court IMPOSED AND STAYED the sentence and placed Defendant on Probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 1 YEAR, to run concurrent to any other sentence, with the following conditions as to probation:
*  No new law violations reaching the level of a probable cause finding.
*  Cooperate with agent.
*  Pay costs, surcharges, assessments, supervision, and DNA fees to be paid during the period of probation.  Failure to pay shall result in a Civil Judgment with tax intercept.
*  Maintain full time / part time employment and or schooling.
*  Mental Health assessment and treatment.
*  Restitution set at ZERO on this case.
*  Restitution Hearing set for 04-06-2016 at 08:30 am regarding restitution on 15CM003747 (Dismissed and Read-In) case.
*  Defendant required to provide a biological specimen (DNA) to the State Crime Lab for testing.

CONDITION OF PROBATION:  COURT SENTENCED Defendant to serve 45 DAYS Condition Time at the House of Correction. Condition Time will be IMPOSED AND STAYED to be used at the discretion of the agent for any violations.

Received and filed with court:
*  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief Form
*  Crime Victim Impact Statement Form

Defendant Maurice Wayne Williams in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Margaret Anne Kunisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Defendant waived rights and pled GUILTY.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the Defendant guilty as charged in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered.  Parties are prepared to proceed with Sentencing.  R
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Maurice Wayne Williams in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Margaret Anne Kunisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    All parties are advised effective February 1, 2016 this case is assigned to Reserve Judge, Branch 04, Room 515 of the Courthouse.  Any right of substitution begins to run as of the date of receipt of this notice, unless notified by the court on an earlier date.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 3, 2016 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Maurice Wayne Williams in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.

Signed, Filed & Distributed, Agreed Upon Request for A New Court Date form. Case adjourned to Branch 45.  Plea hearing scheduled for November 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Michael P.; Julie P.; Megan P. or Eve jewelry at 5011 W Fond du Lac Avenue, Milwaukee, WI  53216

Defendant Maurice Wayne Williams in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Maurice Wayne Williams in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Michelle Ackerman Havas, Branch 45.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 13, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
